Answer: A: She says the Patriot is a bulky portable box that must be wedged in front of the seat, is heavy, and would be a hassleâ€”confirmed by an on-screen product page showing the Blue Ox Patriot.

The speaker mentions that the Blue Ox Patriot is a portable box that needs to be placed in front of the driver's seat, which would make it difficult to use while driving her full-time RV. Additionally, she describes the product as heavy and cumbersome, which would likely be inconvenient to use on the road. The on-screen product page image confirms this description by showing the Blue Ox Patriot as a large, rectangular box.

The options that are both mentioned by the speaker and also shown on screen are A: A Roadmaster InvisiBrake unit integrated into the towed vehicle and B: Blue Ox tow arms/hitch hardware connected to the truck.
